image.altText: A graphic composite of a man. Half of him is in surgical scrubs in a hospital. The other is him wearing a singlet on a street .

props.synopsis: It took a viral video for Australia to see a side of a celebrated neurosurgeon that some of his colleagues and patients had known about for years.

title.children: When video of this surgeon went viral, those who worked with him weren't shocked

image.altText: Sussan Ley smiles as she walks down a corridor.

props.synopsis: When the federal parliament finally sits this week for the first time since the election, the full depth of the Liberal Party's electoral humiliation — just six Liberal women in the lower house — will be on display in the House of Representatives.

title.children: Albanese buoyed by Newspoll as Ley confronts Coalition's defeat

image.altText: A child collects food in a pot, another is visibly distressed reaching out.

props.synopsis: At least 73 people have been killed while attempting to access aid in locations across Gaza, the health ministry in the Palestinian territory said.

title.children: More than 70 Palestinians killed waiting for aid across Gaza, health ministry says

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair and glasses looks serious while looking at something out of frame

props.synopsis: Yulia Svyrydenko says supplying Ukraine's army with what it needs to fight Russia is her top priority, but her new appointment has not pleased everyone.

title.children: Ukraine's new PM elevated after biggest wartime cabinet reshuffle

image.altText: A man frowns and crosses his arms.

props.synopsis: A new report has found almost a quarter of HR professionals are now classifying workers aged between 51 and 55 as "older".

title.children: 'Old' at 51? Recruiters hiring based on age over experience, report finds

image.altText: Peter Ryan Business Editor retires 2025

props.synopsis: A look back at the life of Peter Ryan and his career as an award-winning journalist.

title.children: ABC journalist Peter Ryan dies, leaving 'significant legacy'

image.altText: Silhouettes of helicopters and crew on a runway at sunset.

props.synopsis: The top-ranked Dutch military official warns Australia will need to increase its defence capabilities in response to China's military build-up.

title.children: This Australian ally has a warning on defence spending

image.altText: A man in a black suit and pink tie shake the hand of a man in a dark blue suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: Four Ts dominated the conversation about Anthony Albanese's China trip: Trump, tariffs, Taiwan and trade. But look a little deeper and it's clear green iron was a key talking point, too.

title.children: Why Albanese tried to do a Hawke during last week's China trip

image.altText: A woman in an orange cardigan sitting at an outdoor table looking at a letter.

props.synopsis: The state government stands to make more than $2b from insurance stamp duty in the 2027-28 financial year.

title.children: 'Robbing people blind': State set to profit $2 billion from stamp duty

image.altText: Man sitting at outside table with grey beard and black shirt looks at camera

props.synopsis: Consumption of illicit tobacco is growing as more tobacconists pop up and revenue is lost from the legal excise.

title.children: 'Not exactly a hidden trade': Illicit tobacco undermining health and budget

image.altText: A photo from above a beach at Frankston South showing an unauthorised beach wall being built by a local resident.

props.synopsis: Gene Neill was told to stop work on an unauthorised retaining wall in March but has continued regardless, saying he has to protect his Frankston South mansion from erosion.

title.children: Melbourne man building unauthorised seawall welcomes legal action

image.altText: An elderly man sat in a chair in a garden

props.synopsis: Patients in every state and territory can expect to wait months, if not years, for non-urgent public dental care.

title.children: Don can't afford a private dentist. It will be the focus of Medicare push

image.altText: The Japanese prime minister at a press conference from an election tallyroom.

props.synopsis: Exit polls show Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition losing its majority in country's upper house, the latest in a string of poor election results.

title.children: Japanese PM faces worst election result since 1999

image.altText: A wide shot of a ferry on fire out at sea with a large smoke trail.

props.synopsis: People are seen jumping into the water as smoke billows from a burning passenger ferry fire in the Indonesian province of North Sulawesi.

title.children: Indonesian ferry passengers jump from vessel as fire kills three people

image.altText: Electronic instruments mounted on a pole, in the rain.

props.synopsis: A new weather station at Mansfield in north-east Victoria could close a critical forecasting gap, offering residents more accurate data for the first time.

title.children: Town sick of unreliable BOM forecasts installs own weather station

image.altText: A close up of a an aid workers shirt sleeve that says China Aid in read.

props.synopsis: China is expected to fill a gap in aid funding to Australia's region as the Trump administration slashes US development programs.

title.children: Trump's aid cuts boost China's importance in South-East Asia, Lowy finds

image.altText: Tim Tszyu is on the ground

props.synopsis: Soundly beaten in Las Vegas, Tim Tszyu's career path does not have a world title in it for the foreseeable future, meaning it may be time to consider an extreme option.

title.children: A nightmare Vegas return shows the desperate truth that Tszyu must acknowledge

image.altText: A man with white hair wearing a suit, tie and glasses sits in a bubble bath holding a glass of champagne

props.synopsis: Comedian Mark Humphries is used to using humour to tackle real issues of injustice. His latest comedic documentary takes aim at Australia's housing crisis.

title.children: Alan Kohler in a bubble bath will help explain Australia's housing crisis

image.altText: Dean Winter speaks at a lectern with Josh Willie standing behind him

props.synopsis: The final make up of Tasmania's new parliament will take some time to be confirmed as the leaders of both major parties start talking to crossbenchers, saying Tasmanians want their MPs to work more collaboratively.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberal, Labor leaders start talking to the crossbench

image.altText: Three for sale signs on a cul-de-sac in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Interstate investors are targeting homes across the Northern Territory and buying them up hours before they hit the market, as recent data shows Darwin has the tightest rental market in the country.

title.children: Interstate investors swarm NT homes, shutting out locals and raising rents

image.altText: A composite image depicting Craig Garland, Peter George and Kristie Johnston

props.synopsis: If either the Liberals or Labor wants to hold government in Tasmania, they will need the support of an almost entirely anti-stadium crossbench.

title.children: Tasmania set for a mostly anti-stadium crossbench — how will that work?

image.altText: American golfer Scottie Scheffler stands on a green smiling, holding a trophy after winning The Open Championship.

props.synopsis: Scottie Scheffler shows why he is men's golf world number one, easing to victory in The Open Championship at Royal Portrush to clinch his fourth major title.

title.children: Supreme Scheffler a class apart as he romps to first Open title

image.altText: An aerial proposal shot of a group of islands on the ocean

props.synopsis: If you believe the hype, cities may float, fly, or stretch for miles by 2050, with proposed plans, including sky gardens, solar walls, glow in the dark sand, drone commuting and spaceports.

title.children: What we know about the world's next generation of cities cooked up by billionaires

image.altText: A man stands on a tourist boat that capsized in Ha Long Bay

props.synopsis: A Vietnamese man who survived the capsizing of a tour boat in Ha Long Bay has described his escape from the overturned vessel.

title.children: Ha Long Bay capsized tour boat survivor says he 'saw a streak of light'

image.altText: child holding umbrella in the rain

props.synopsis: Unsettled is how Bureau of Meteorology senior forecaster Felim Hanniffy describes this week's weather for Queensland.

title.children: Fog, frost and showers to start the week in Qld

image.altText: Anthony holding abalone shells

props.synopsis: Calls are ramping up to recognise an algal bloom ravaging South Australian marine life for months as a national emergency. But what difference could such a declaration make?

title.children: How could a 'national disaster' declaration help SA tackle its toxic algal bloom?

image.altText: Luke Jackson celebrates a goal with Nathan O'Driscoll

props.synopsis: Fremantle is burnt by a rarely-seen 50m penalty call in the first half of a pivotal clash but stages a remarkable fourth-quarter comeback to topple Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Dockers overcome 'ridiculous, selective umpiring' to claim thriller over Pies

image.altText: Four rescuers walk through heavy snow in the dark

props.synopsis: Rescuers walked in to meet the family in Tasmania's Mount Field National Park on Saturday night. They brought food and sleeping bags so the family could safely spend the night in an alpine hut before being flown out by helicopter.

title.children: Family rescued after becoming stranded in heavy snow in Tasmanian national park

image.altText: Leka Halasima celebrates his game winner against the Knights with Warriors teammates.

props.synopsis: Leka Halasima scores a stunning try on the siren, scooping up a chargedown and racing 43 metres to score and give the Warriors a 20-15 win over the Knights.

title.children: 'Leka Magic' saves Warriors with miracle last-second try to beat Knights

image.altText: plane crash

props.synopsis: Two men have died in a plane crash at Oakey, west of Brisbane.

title.children: Two men killed in 'fireball' light plane crash west of Brisbane

image.altText: Kurtley Beale in action during an Australian Wallabies training session

props.synopsis: Kurtley Beale will get his chance to face the British and Irish Lions on a second tour after being named captain of the First Nations and Pasifika XV team for Tuesday's clash in Melbourne.

title.children: Beale named captain of First Nations and Pasifika XV to face Lions

image.altText: The wooden baptist church, photographed under cloudy, overcast skies.

props.synopsis: Mushroom lunch survivor and pastor Ian Wilkinson has made his return to the Korumburra Baptist Church for the first time since Erin Patterson was convicted of murdering his wife.

title.children: Mushroom lunch survivor returns to church after Patterson guilty verdict

image.altText: Heavy rain hits South Korea

props.synopsis: Recent heavy rainfall that caused floods and a landslide is likely to soon stop and be followed by a heatwave, the government weather forecaster says.

title.children: Death toll climbs in South Korea amid heavy rain

image.altText: A man in a white button up shirt stands with his arms up and holds a black cap in his right hand.

props.synopsis: As an suspected link was revealed between the Sinaloa Cartel and the men accused of killing Australian surfers, the cartel came under a spotlight in the US, as a son of fallen leader El Chapo struck a deal with prosecutors.

title.children: The cartel linked to Australian surfers' murders is at war with itself

image.altText: A diver wearing scuba gear holds a triangular stone up to the camera, illuminated by soft light streaming through the water.

props.synopsis: For years, researchers have been trying to find ancient artefacts sitting on the ocean floor. Now they have brought in Indigenous rangers to help.

title.children: Survey of Australia's seabed turns up 'lost' archaeological treasures
